meanings.definition: To examine by touch, especially for medical purposes.
meanings.sent1: The doctor palpated the patient's abdomen to check for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent2: She palpated the fruit to see if it was ripe enough to eat.
meanings.sent3: The detective palpated the crime scene for any clues left behind.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers palpated the rough texture of the tree bark.
meanings.sent5: The blindfolded man palpated the objects in front of him to guess what they were.

meanings.definition: To feel or touch (something) with the hands.
meanings.sent1: The child palpated the soft fur of the puppy with delight.
meanings.sent2: He palpated the fabric to see if it was smooth to the touch.
meanings.sent3: She palpated the dough to check if it was ready to be baked.
meanings.sent4: The artist palpated the clay, shaping it into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The explorer palpated the ancient artifact, feeling its intricate carvings.
